item.title: Consumer Card achieves outstanding success, according to DIB's report
item.description:
Source: DIB website. Banner for the Consumer Card page. The Consumer Card, a collaboration between the Department of Economic Development (DED) in Dubai and Dubai Islamic Bank (DIB), the largest Islamic bank in the UAE, has surpassed expectations in a very competitive market by the close of 2016. This success highlights how much customers value the card’s transparency and customer-centric approach. Customers appreciate the card’s straightforward rewards system, which focuses on everyday transactions rather than requiring increased spending...

item.title: ADIB and Rotana have partnered to introduce the exclusive ADIB Rotana Rewards Card
item.description:
Abu Dhabi Islamic Bank (ADIB) and Rotana, a hotel management company, have teamed up to introduce the ADIB Rotana Rewards Exclusive Card. This card allows members to earn Rotana Rewards points and enjoy special benefits whenever they use it for purchases. Source: ADIB. From left: Sarvesh Sarup, Global Head of Retail Banking, ADIB, and Omer Z. Kaddouri, President and CEO Rotana. This card is the first of its kind in the Central Eastern Europe & Middle East and Africa (CEEMEA) region to be co-branded with a hospitality company and developed by a local issuer...

item.title: Dubai Islamic Bank has been included in LinkedIn's Most In-Demand Employers 2015 list for the MENA region
item.description:
Source: DIB. Dubai Islamic Bank (DIB), the leading Islamic bank in the UAE, has been acknowledged by LinkedIn as one of the most desirable employers in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region. DIB secured the 16th position on LinkedIn’s “Most In-Demand Employers” 2015 list for the MENA region, placing it among the top 10 local brands and making it the only bank to achieve this distinction. LinkedIn annually publishes a list of top employers globally based on extensive data gathered from billions of member interactions...

item.title: Alizz Islamic Bank has enhanced its mobile application
item.description:
Source: Alizz Islamic Bank. The app. Alizz Islamic Bank has introduced a redesigned mobile banking app and online platform to solidify its position as a customer experience frontrunner in Oman. The dual-language app, compatible with both Android and iOS devices, boasts high-level security features and a self-registration option. Users can conveniently manage web banking logins, money transfers, bill payments, and other transactions using QR codes. The app is compatible with 3D Touch technology and is the first of its kind in Oman to provide in-app alerts for new transactions and payment reminders...

item.title: ADIB introduces the Spice credit card specifically for Non-Resident Indians and Non-Resident Pakistanis
item.description:
Source: ADIB. The new Spice Card offers a range of cashbacks if the owner hits a minimum spend. Abu Dhabi Islamic Bank (ADIB) has introduced the Spice Card, a new product designed specifically for non-resident Indians (NRIs) and non-resident Pakistanis (NRPs) living in the UAE. The ADIB Spice Card provides NRIs and NRPs with opportunities to save money through a variety of competitive offers and discounts. These include cashback rewards of 9% on dining, 7% on supermarket purchases, 4% on fuel, and 1% on utility bills...
